treatment.description: Mostly taller or more arching to diffuse than no. 146; primocanes often brandling, up to 1.8 m. long, occasionally tip-rooting; longer prickles 6-9 mm. long; primocane-leaves mostly 3-foliolate, copiously strigose-pilose above when young, loosely cinereous-tomentulose beneath; the leaflets elliptic, ovate or elliptic-obovate, acuminate, membranaceous, scarcely furrowed above, coarsely dentate, the divergent broad teeth with a triangular callous tip; terminal leaflet 3-5-8.5 cm. long, 2.5-5.5 cm. broad; upper bracts of inflorescence often simple, broad, dentate, 1.5-7 cm. long; fruit rich and juicy. (Incl. R. pascuus and R. acer Bailey; R. uliginosus Fern.)
